column1: I am thankful for the opportunity to represent such a strong vibrant and generous #GA07 community.   To each and every one of you and your families I wish you a happy and healthy Thanksgiving. https://t.co/6Vir3XS1M3

Improving @USDOL's Apprenticeship Program is a real partnership opportunity for my colleagues in the House but I'm afraid that @HouseDemocrats have chosen to go-it-alone once again.  We can do better. Let's work together to deliver for our young people. https://t.co/fsLuK8tovU

Children and youth across our country deserve families who love and support them each day. This #NationalAdoptionMonth let's spread the word about the importance of adoption in our communities.   To learn more visit https://t.co/q9SFcaMADp https://t.co/9cHPkfVpqz
Happy Diwali! To all those celebrating I wish you and your family a holiday of peace joy and prosperity. https://t.co/sRAJcq2vXS

This #VeteransDay2020 we pause to honor the service and sacrifice of each and every veteran who has served in our nation's military.   To all our veterans and their families thank you and happy Veterans Day! https://t.co/RmOSvjZkB0
GEORGIA VOTERS:   If you arrive to the polls this evening before 7PM and find yourself in line do not leave before casting your ballot. It is your right to vote. Stay in line! https://t.co/MUTdwn622M

Strong families are the bedrock of America and I am proud to introduce the American Families United Act alongside my colleagues @RepEscobar and @RepDarrenSoto.  To learn more visit the webpage below: https://t.co/Afzy4BEsOJ

After a historic recession our economy experienced the largest economic growth ever recorded in American history this quarter.   Sound economic policy and common-sense COVID-19 preventative measures will ensure that the U.S. continues to bounce back.  https://t.co/cLR5Dc17lF

Judge Amy Coney Barrett is exceptionally qualified to serve our nation as an Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court and I applaud my colleagues in the Senate for their vote to confirm Judge Barrett this evening. https://t.co/iJ1PbApnZP

This #NationalDayOfTheDeployed I would like to thank our brave men and women in uniform who serve and have served the United States around the globe and their families who bear that burden.   Your dedication and sacrifice are truly inspirational. https://t.co/PR8qqpgYaJ

As we recognize #DyslexiaAwarenessMonth this October I would like to commend one of our local nonprofits working to empower parents teachers and students--the Dyslexia Network of Forsyth.  To learn more about Dyslexia and local resources visit https://t.co/hxlaY40maR.  #GoRed

This Saturday the Forsyth County Public Library will be holding its annual Special Needs Resource Fair for families with special needs children and adults--incredible members of our 7th District community.   Tune in at 10AM using the link below:  https://t.co/kDYSwciOYV

This week my colleagues and I on @ModernizeCmte released our *final report* of 97 bipartisan recommendations to make Congress work better for the American people.   Read it here: https://t.co/6phlL9WECb https://t.co/QLcOLNfxIv

All mothers deserve access to quality maternal health care which is why I am calling for #BlanketChange to put moms and babies first.   To learn more about improving and expanding access to maternal health care visit https://t.co/Y2HbMeuRAa.

A special thanks to my friends at the Rotary Club of Sugarloaf for raising nearly $25000 for local nonprofits at their annual Duck Derby--an incredible achievement for our community. https://t.co/0bsiHWZj0T

Today is the last day to respond to the #2020Census. This critical count ensures that Georgia is well represented in the federal government.   If you haven't done so already fill out the Census at https://t.co/tuod203lpM.
Happy 245th birthday to the @USNavy!   To all our Navy service members and veterans thank you for your service to our nation. https://t.co/GTqXrTqfVV
It is time for Congress to put politics aside and come together to deliver #COVID19 relief.   The American people deserve an effective bipartisan solution that serves the needs of our communities.

October is Down Syndrome Awareness Month--a time to recognize the incredible contributions the Down syndrome community has made in our country. To learn more visit the link below:  https://t.co/6NyHiUFm9l

If you haven't registered to #vote make sure you do so by Monday October 5th--Georgia's voter registration deadline.  No matter how you choose to cast your ballot I hope you will join me in exercising your right to vote. Register using the link below:  https://t.co/tM8cU1Lq0f https://t.co/n1m1iVY103

This @MfgDay I hope you will join me in celebrating our incredible Georgia manufacturers--the backbone of our local economy.   Students interested in learning more about being a part of the next generation of American creators check out the link below:  https://t.co/KnyJPBd5RR

Tomorrow at 4PM Georgia's Under Secretary for Benefits is hosting a tele-Town Hall for #Veterans and their families. The discussion will cover the VA's COVID-19 response the Blue Water Navy Act and the Solid Start program.   Veterans I encourage you to tune in at 833-380-0417

Congratulations to Cornerstone Christian Academy for being named a National Blue Ribbon School for 2020! Cornerstone was one of only 50 private schools that were recognized--an incredible achievement!  https://t.co/h6yVjAwgy5

Our Military Service Academy cadets and graduates represent the very best our community has to offer. As a reminder applications for Service Academy nominations are due to my office by this Friday October 2nd.   https://t.co/salemA3zeG

I appreciate the efforts of our leaders at @ATLairport to ensure the world’s busiest airport is as safe as possible for travelers during the continued public health emergency as well as their commitment to engaging with the public. Read more below.   https://t.co/YazR0LuWiO
G'mar Chatima Tova!  To all those in our Jewish community observing Yom Kippur today may you have an easy fast and a day of meaningful reflection. https://t.co/gUO9qLgy01

Civic and cultural events and programs make our communities richer and more prosperous. Georgia Humanities offers funding opportunities for these programs and groups interested in learning more can visit the link below.  https://t.co/yETBbv0Mrd https://t.co/l3Am2BoMWP

I am proud to have been a part of the bipartisan work that has taken place in the @ModernizeCmte this Congress. In our final meeting today we passed a set of 40 recommendations to ensure that Congress can better serve you. Now let's move them forward. https://t.co/BQJ7mwk6Ft

Let's make sure Georgia is counted. Census collection efforts wrap up on September 30th. If you haven't already please complete the census form and encourage friends and family to do the same.  https://t.co/qEZIC0EUJr

L’shanah tovah u’metukah!   I want to extend my wishes for a happy and healthy new year to all celebrating Rosh Hashanah this weekend. As we move from 5780 to 5781 I hope this High Holiday season brings a special sense of joy and renewal to you and your family. https://t.co/ZfWhgNtO7O

As I said on the House floor too often this Chamber mistakes passing something with a partisan majority as getting something done. I hope House Leaders will embrace opportunities to advance reforms like the bills discussed today in a bipartisan way. https://t.co/YDmiDu7I5w

Today marks 19 years since the horrific attacks committed against America on September 11th. Today we mourn those whom we lost and we celebrate the heroism of our police and firefighters who charged into danger to save lives at the risk of their own. #NeverForget https://t.co/vYum7gp1ie

At 1 PM today @housebudgetGOP will investigate the impacts of Artificial Intelligence on the U.S. economy and workforce including AI’s role in furthering our economic recovery. You can tune in to our discussion by clicking the link below.   https://t.co/LPuIpBveJQ

I was honored to welcome Secretary @BetsyDeVosED to the 7th District today during her visit to Forsyth Central High School. I am proud of the efforts of all those at @FCSchoolsGA who are leading by example to ensure the safety of students teachers and staff as schools reopen. https://t.co/npqjd2IFyj

Today is the 104th birthday of the @NatlParkService (NPS) and to celebrate the NPS is waiving entrance fees to all of its parks. If you have time today go visit one of Georgia’s NPS parks!   https://t.co/2y54ORyUnx https://t.co/500C9dGTm4

Today the @ModernizeCmte passed a series of recommendations to ensure that Congress can continue to serve the American people through the duration of this pandemic and during future emergencies. I was proud to support this bipartisan initiative.   https://t.co/9c1b4LMRG7

John Lewis has been a leader on causes good and right my entire lifetime and we have undeniably lost one of our uniters in Congress in John.  Please keep his friends and family in your prayers today and keep close to heart his message of unity and peace.  https://t.co/baM2231p2c https://t.co/BU9x34cZ59

Congressman John Lewis – who served the people of Georgia in the House for more than three decades – will lie in state today at the U.S. Capitol. You can view a live stream of those services below.  https://t.co/zXuWpSZBLT https://t.co/CEuReVdMNZ

Today the @TransportGOP will be considering bipartisan legislation – the Water Resources Development Act of 2020  – which invests in critical projects like Lake Lanier and the Savannah Harbor. Click below to tune in! https://t.co/4qU9ATjRBf https://t.co/uW9wXVwrAB

When my friends across the aisle talk about investing in America and the need to address our crumbling infrastructure they are right. It's time now to join together with bipartisan solutions that will better serve the needs of the American people. https://t.co/i6ayYNt7YN

While I’m disappointed that my friends across the aisle have seen fit to continue their go-it-alone strategy I am hopeful that these bills mark a meaningful starting point to further legislation that is more responsive to the needs of the American people. https://t.co/HUPE2GutJ3

I would like to thank the Gwinnett/Forsyth Citizens’ Climate Lobby for hosting a discussion on raising awareness on climate change and moving forward with effective bipartisan solutions. Your commitment and passion on these issues is encouraging! https://t.co/pfWGN7lHBt
Happy Father’s Day to all the dads here in the Seventh District! Watching you go above and beyond for your families has been inspiring and today we celebrate you!

Today as Americans joyfully celebrate #Juneteenth the world community is drawing awareness to the fight against Sickle Cell Disease which disproportionately affects people of African and Caribbean descent. Click below to learn more: https://t.co/alrTZCp4vu

For as long as I've been in Congress the Transportation Committee has always valued bipartisan collaboration. I'm disappointed that this tradition has been cast aside in favor of advancing a far-left policy agenda that is sure to fail in the Senate: https://t.co/ulnPP15AeP

Yesterday I was pleased to see this Administration take action and launch the Civil Rights Reporting Portal – a tool that makes it easier for people to report unlawful discrimination. Click below for more information: https://t.co/cEKti0n7BL

America’s leaders – from the President and Congress to city councils – are carefully examining additional pandemic response solutions. Click below for the latest from Capitol Hill: https://t.co/w1Ka9vpg30

I was deeply saddened by the news of Sam Johnson’s passing yesterday. Sam was a great American patriot who served our country with distinction for over 60 years. It is a great honor of mine to have met and worked with him here in Congress.

We had an opportunity in the Rules Committee today to add a bipartisan amendment to the FISA Act which would further protect our civil liberties. Unfortunately the Committee decided to forego that opportunity: https://t.co/015CidAlxV
For the first time in nearly a decade American astronauts are headed to space. Tune in below at 4:33 pm to watch today’s historic launch: https://t.co/5RNK7h46Pt

Gwinnett County will be hosting a drive-thru farmer’s market this Wednesday from 3 – 7 pm at Coolray Field in Lawrenceville. This is an incredible opportunity to support our local farmers and buy fresh healthy food. Click below to learn more: https://t.co/mEOfOc3hX9

Today on #MemorialDay I would like to honor the brave men and women who paid the ultimate price to protect our freedoms and their families. Their courage and sacrifice will never be forgotten. https://t.co/S8kYdRy613

To my constituents and all of our Muslim friends and neighbors who observe Ramadan across the nation I hope this was a month of peaceful reflection spiritual growth and generosity. I wish you a Blessed Eid and hope you have a joyful breaking of fast with your loved ones.
Gwinnett will be hosting a virtual edition of its annual Memorial Day ceremony this Monday at 1 pm.  Click below to find out how you can tune in: https://t.co/Vvwziak1VG

Just in time for Memorial Day Johns Creek’s 250-foot replica of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial known as the Wall That Heals has finally been completed. Click below to learn more about this incredible new memorial: https://t.co/HjnmatIYT6
The Library of Congress is offering free one-hour webinars for educators who would like to learn how to use primary sources to teach their students. Click below to learn more: https://t.co/tVKb5WWo6Q

I would like to extend my sincerest congratulations to Peachtree Ridge’s Alice Ao and Northview’s Albert Zhang for being named Georgia’s two U.S. Presidential Scholars. It’s incredible to see the 7th District so aptly represented among the nation’s top academic honorees. https://t.co/3n5q9j4qSy
Early voting for the Georgia primaries starts today. You can check your voter registration status find out where to vote or see a sample ballot here: https://t.co/M4ZEtzClAi

Today the House passed the HEROES Act – a 1800 page $3 trillion bill that doesn’t have a chance of ever becoming law. I’m disappointed that my colleagues across the aisle failed to set aside their partisan agenda and address the real issues surrounding this pandemic.

Yesterday in Rules Committee I offered an amendment to allow the House to pass the emergency Covid-related parts of the 1800 bill and leave the liberal wish-list items where they belong; in another bill at another time. This amendment was defeated by every Democrat. @HouseGOP https://t.co/Yg6GHYzh5J
https://t.co/ySMxpLIxgU

Happy Easter and Passover to you and your loved ones! I believe this holy season can serve to remind us that there is more that unites us than divides us and that we're all in this together.

Yesterday I had the opportunity to review the President's budget for FY 2021 and I am encouraged to see a plan that takes meaningful steps to tackle our ever-increasing mandatory spending.   Correcting our America's fiscal trajectory should be Congress’ top priority.
